Packet.Name: Character Creation
Packet.Data: Client Flags (0x01 = Felucca Facet, 0x02 = Trammel Facet, 0x04 = Ilshenar Facet, 0x08 = Malas Facet, 0x10 = Tokuno Facet, 0x20 = Ter Mur Facet, 0x40 = UO3D Client, 0x80 = Reserved for Facet06, 0x100 = UOTD)
Gender and Race: (0x00 = human male, 0x01 = human female, 0x02 = human male, 0x03 = human female, 0x04 = elf male, 0x05 = elf female, 0x06 = gargoyle male, 0x07 = gargoyle female)

Packet.Name: Logout
Packet.Desc: Character returns to main menu from character select menu.

Packet.Name: Movement Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server if we can walk.
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)

Packet.Name: Ascii Speech
Packet.Desc: Send ascii speech to the server.
Packet.Data: Mode (0x00 = say, 0x01 = system, 0x02 = emote, 0x06 = label, 0x07 = focus, 0x08 = whipser, 0x09 = yell, 0x10 = spell, 0x13 = guild, 0x14 = alliance, 0x15 = GM, 0x20 = special, 0xC0 = encoded commands)

Packet.Name: Attack Request
Packet.Note: If Last Attack and combatant is null, send owner's serial.

Packet.Name: Use Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server if we can use an object (double click).

Packet.Name: Lift Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server if we can lift an object.

Packet.Name: Drop Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server if we can lift an object.
Packet.Note: Grid Location only since 6.0.1.7 2D and 2.45.5.6 UO3D

Packet.Name: Look Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server to look at an item (single click).

Packet.Name: Edit Item
Packet.Desc: Edit npcs, dynamic and static items.
Packet.Note: Types are: 0x04 = Dynamic Item, 0x07 = NPC, 0x0A = Static Item, 0x0B = Add New Static Item (Force Static Creation)

Packet.Name: Damage Packet
Packet.Note: Before 4.0.7a 2D client, was an Edit Area packet

Packet.Name: Mobile Status
Packet.Data: Supported Features (0x02 = T2A attributes, 0x03 = Renaissance attributes, 0x04 = AOS attributes, 0x05 = ML attributes, 0x06 = KR attributes)

Packet.Name: Use Skill/LastSkill
Packet.Data: Skill ID (from 1 to 58 at present time, if SkillID = 0, it means that is lastskill)

Packet.Name: Cast Skill from the spellbook
Packet.Desc: Cast Skill from the spellbook Packet.

Packet.Name: Use Scroll
Packet.Note: Self-dclick and target packet. If item has 0xEF3 itemid (scroll) and you will double click it, 2D client will create internal target and when you targeted something, server get this packet. Note: no dclick/target packets for server - just internal work.

Packet.Name: Open Spellbook
Packet.Data: Spellbook ID (1 = Mage Spellbook, 2 = Necro Spellbook, 3 = Paladin Spellbook, 4 = Bushido Spellbook, 5 = Ninjitsu Spellbook, 6 = SpellWeaving Spellbook, 7 = Mysticism Spellbook).

Packet.Name: Change Hue
Packet.Data: Arguments (Object Serial or "X Y Z" for static)

Packet.Name: Invoke Virtue
Packet.Data: Virtue ID (0x00 = None, 0x01 = Honor Virtue, 0x02 = Sacrifice Virtue, 0x03 = Valor Virtue, 0x04 = Compassion Virtue, 0x05 = Honesty Virtue, 0x06 = Humility Virtue, 0x07 = Justice Virtue, 0x08 = Spirituality)

Packet.Name: Equip Request
Packet.Desc: Ask the server if we can equip an object.
Packet.Data: Item Layer (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = One Handed, 0x02 = Tho Handed, 0x03 = Shoes, 0x04 = Pants; 0x05 = Shirt, 0x06 = Helm, 0x07 = Gloves, 0x08 = Ring, 0x09 = Talisman, 0x0A = Neck, 0x0B = Hair, 0x0C = Waist, 0x0D = Inner Torso, 0x0E = Bracelet, 0x0F = Face, 0x10 = Facial Hair, 0x11 = Middle Torso, 0x12 = Earrings, 0x13 = Arms, 0x14 = Cloak, 0x15 = Backpack, 0x16 = Outer Torso, 0x17 = Outer Legs, 0x18 = Inner Legs, 0x19 = Mount, 0x1A = Shop Buy, 0x1B = Shop Resale, 0x1C = Shop Sell, 0x1D = Bank, 0x1E = Shop Max)

Packet.Name: UO3D Mobile New Health Bar Status
Packet.Desc: UO3D Mobile New Health Bar Status.
Packet.Data: Extended (1 if status bar is green or yellow, else 0)
Status Color (0x01 = Green, 0x02 = Yellow, sends only if extended == 1)
Flag (0x00 = Remove Status Color, 0x01 = Enable Status Color, sends only if extended == 1)
Packet.Note: If mobile is poisoned, flag value > 0x00 - poison level. Since 4.0.7.0/7.0.7.0, sends to both 2d and 3d but works only in 3d. Server sends it as response for 0x34 Mobile Status Query.

Packet.Name: Mobile Health Bar Status Update
Packet.Data: Flag (0x00 = Remove Status Color, 0x01 = Enable Status Color)
Packet.Note: If mobile is poisoned, flag value > 0x00 - poison level

Packet.Name: World Item
Packet.Data: Y (if hue != 0 add 0x8000. if flags != 0 add 0x4000)
Light Level (TileData.Quality) (only if item has LightSource flag)
Flags (0x20 = Show Properties; 0x80 = Hidden) (only if Flags != 0)
Packet.Note: No longer used since UO:SA.

Packet.Name: Login Confirm
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)

Packet.Name: Ascii Message
Packet.Data: Message Type (0x00 = Regular, 0x01 = System, 0x02 = Emote, 0x06 = Label, 0x07 = Focus, 0x08 = Whisper, 0x09 = Yell, 0x0A = Spell, 0x0D = Guild, 0x0E = Alliance, 0x0F = GM Request, 0x10 = GM Response, 0x20 = Special, 0xC0 = Encoded

Packet.Name: Animate
Packet.Note: Unknown packet

Packet.Name: Explode
Packet.Note: Unknown packet

Packet.Name: Mobile Update
Packet.Data: Flags (0x01 = Frozen, 0x02 = Female, 0x04 = Flying, 0x08 = Yellow HealthBar, 0x10 = Ignore Mobiles, 0x40 = War Mode, 0x80 = Hidden)
Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)

Packet.Name: Movement Rejected
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)

Packet.Name: Container Display
Packet.Data: Container Type (0x00 for vendors, 0x7D for spellbooks and containers)
Packet.Note: Container Type was added in UO:HS clients.

Packet.Name: Container Content Update
Packet.Note: Grid Location only since 6.0.1.7 2D and 2.45.5.6 UO3D

Packet.Name: Lift Rejected
Packet.Data: Reason (0x00 = Cannot Lift, 0x01 = Out Of Range, 0x02 = Out Of Sight, 0x03 = Try To Steel, 0x04 = Are Holding, 0x05 = Inspecific)

Packet.Name: Equip Update
Packet.Data: Layer (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = One Handed, 0x02 = Tho Handed, 0x03 = Shoes, 0x04 = Pants; 0x05 = Shirt, 0x06 = Helm, 0x07 = Gloves, 0x08 = Ring, 0x09 = Talisman, 0x0A = Neck, 0x0B = Hair, 0x0C = Waist, 0x0D = Inner Torso, 0x0E = Bracelet, 0x0F = Face, 0x10 = Facial Hair, 0x11 = Middle Torso, 0x12 = Earrings, 0x13 = Arms, 0x14 = Cloak, 0x15 = Backpack, 0x16 = Outer Torso, 0x17 = Outer Legs, 0x18 = Inner Legs, 0x19 = Mount, 0x1A = Shop Buy, 0x1B = Shop Resale, 0x1C = Shop Sell, 0x1D = Bank, 0x1E = Shop Max)

Packet.Name: Mobile Query
Packet.Data: Type (0x00 = God Client Command, 0x04 = Stats Request, 0x05 = Skills Request)

Packet.Name: Skills Update
Packet.Data: List Type (0x02 = capped, 0xDF = delta, 0xFF = no loop)

Packet.Name: Container Content
Packet.Note: Also old packet for Spellbook Content with spells instead of items: spell serial = 0x7FFFFFFF - spell index, Item ID = Direction = X = Y = Hue = 0, Amount = Index + Spell Offset

Packet.Name: Versions
Packet.Note: Client returns 0x4B - Check Version with dword indexNumber + 7 and dword versionNumber for that index
This packet requires an EditServer login to function properly.

Packet.Name: Update Statics
Packet.Note: Blocks Number = X / 8 * 512 + Y / 8

Packet.Name: Update Terrains
Packet.Note: Blocks Number = X / 8 * 512 + Y / 8

Packet.Name: Version OK
Packet.Note: From Server to Godclient.
This packet requires an EditServer login to function properly.

Packet.Name: Check Version
Packet.Note: Server should send 0x45 - Version OK with matching lookup. Client will send another 0x4B with lookup - 1, until 0x45 w/ 0 lookup is met.
This packet requires an EditServer login to function properly.

Packet.Name: Popup Message
Packet.Data: (0x00 = bad password, 0x01 = no character, 0x02 = character exists, 0x05 = character already in world, 0x06 = login problem, 0x07 = idle, 0x09 = character transfer, 0x10 = invalid name)

Packet.Name: Map Plot
Packet.Data: Action (0x01 = add pin, 0x02 = insert pin, 0x03 = change pin, 0x04 = remove pin, 0x05 = clear map, 0x06 = toggle edit map)

Packet.Name: Play Character
Packet.Data: Client Flags (0x01 = Felucca Facet, 0x02 = Trammel Facet, 0x04 = Ilshenar Facet, 0x08 = Malas Facet, 0x10 = Tokuno Facet, 0x20 = Ter Mur Facet, 0x40 = UO3D Client, 0x80 = Reserved for Facet06, 0x100 = UOTD)

Packet.Name: Change Weather
Packet.Data: Weather Type (0x00 = rain; 0x01 = fierce storm, 0x02 = snow; 0x03 = storm; 0xFE = set temperature; 0xFF = stop all weather)

Packet.Name: Target
Packet.Data: Target Type (0x00 = Object Target, 0x01 = Tile Target)
Flags (0x00 = None, 0x01 = Harmful, 0x02 = Beneficial, 0x03 = Cancel Target)

Packet.Name: Animation
Packet.Note: No longer used since UO:SA launch

Packet.Name: Graphical Effect
Packet.Data: Type (0x00 = from source to destination, 0x01 = lightning strike, 0x02 = stay with destination, 0x03 = stay with source, 0x04 = special effects)
Object ID (for type = 0x04 use 0x00 - 0x04 values for different special flash effects)
Packet.Note: Since UO:SA this packet can be used for special effects.

Packet.Name: Get Message Summary Bulletin Board
Packet.Desc: Get Message Summary Bulletin Board Packet.

Packet.Name: Mobile Moving
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)
Flags (0x01 = Frozen, 0x02 = Female, 0x04 = Flying, 0x08 = Yellow HealthBar, 0x10 = Ignore Mobiles, 0x40 = War Mode, 0x80 = Hidden)
Notoriety (0x01 = Innocent, 0x02 = Ally, 0x03 = Can be attacked, 0x04 = Criminal, 0x05 = Enemy, 0x06 = Murderer, 0x07 = Invulnerable)

Packet.Name: Mobile Incoming
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)
Flags (0x01 = Frozen, 0x02 = Female, 0x04 = Flying, 0x08 = Yellow HealthBar, 0x10 = Ignore Mobiles, 0x40 = War Mode, 0x80 = Hidden)
Notoriety (0x01 = Innocent, 0x02 = Ally, 0x03 = Can be attacked, 0x04 = Criminal, 0x05 = Enemy, 0x06 = Murderer, 0x07 = Invulnerable)

Item Layer (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = One Handed, 0x02 = Tho Handed, 0x03 = Shoes, 0x04 = Pants; 0x05 = Shirt, 0x06 = Helm, 0x07 = Gloves, 0x08 = Ring, 0x09 = Talisman, 0x0A = Neck, 0x0B = Hair, 0x0C = Waist, 0x0D = Inner Torso, 0x0E = Bracelet, 0x0F = Face, 0x10 = Facial Hair, 0x11 = Middle Torso, 0x12 = Earrings, 0x13 = Arms, 0x14 = Cloak, 0x15 = Backpack, 0x16 = Outer Torso, 0x17 = Outer Legs, 0x18 = Inner Legs, 0x19 = Mount, 0x1A = Shop Buy, 0x1B = Shop Resale, 0x1C = Shop Sell, 0x1D = Bank, 0x1E = Shop Max)

Packet.Name: God View Query
Packet.Data: Toggle God View Query (0x00 = Off, 0x01 = On)

Packet.Name: Account Login Rejection
Packet.Data: Rejection Reason (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = Account In Use, 0x02 = Account Blocked, 0x03 = Wrong Password, 0x06 = IGR, 0x09 = Character Transfer, 0xFE = Time Out, 0xFF = Bad Communication)

Packet.Name: Character Delete Result
Packet.Data: Delete Result (0x00 = Bad Password, 0x01 = Character Not Exists, 0x02 = Character In Game, 0x03 = Character Too Young, 0x04 = Character Queeed, 0x05 = Bad Request)

Packet.Name: Corpse Equip
Packet.Data: Item Layer (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = One Handed, 0x02 = Tho Handed, 0x03 = Shoes, 0x04 = Pants; 0x05 = Shirt, 0x06 = Helm, 0x07 = Gloves, 0x08 = Ring, 0x09 = Talisman, 0x0A = Neck, 0x0B = Hair, 0x0C = Waist, 0x0D = Inner Torso, 0x0E = Bracelet, 0x0F = Face, 0x10 = Facial Hair, 0x11 = Middle Torso, 0x12 = Earrings, 0x13 = Arms, 0x14 = Cloak, 0x15 = Backpack, 0x16 = Outer Torso, 0x17 = Outer Legs, 0x18 = Inner Legs, 0x19 = Mount, 0x1A = Shop Buy, 0x1B = Shop Resale, 0x1C = Shop Sell, 0x1D = Bank, 0x1E = Shop Max)

Packet.Name: UO3D Create Character
Packet.Data: Client Flags (0x01 = Felucca Facet, 0x02 = Trammel Facet, 0x04 = Ilshenar Facet, 0x08 = Malas Facet, 0x10 = Tokuno Facet, 0x20 = Ter Mur Facet, 0x40 = UO3D Client, 0x80 = Reserved for Facet06, 0x100 = UOTD)

Packet.Name: Player Move
Packet.Data: Direction (0x00 = North, 0x01 = Right, 0x02 = East, 0x03 = Down, 0x04 = South, 0x05 = Left, 0x06 = West, 0x07 = Up, 0x80 = Running)

Packet.Name: Multi Target
Packet.Data: Target Type (0x00 = Object Target, 0x01 = Tile Target)
Flags (0x00 = None, 0x01 = Harmful, 0x02 = Beneficial, 0x03 = Cancel Target)
Packet.Note: Hue was added in UO:HS clients

Packet.Name: Ascii Prompt Response
Packet.Note: Prompt ID is special type id. See link below for more information.

Packet.Name: Characters List
Packet.Data: Flags (0x01 = unknown flag1; 0x02 = overwrite configuration button; 0x04 = limit 1 character per account; 0x08 = enable context menus; 0x10 = limit character slots; 0x20 = paladin and necromancer classes, tooltips; 0x40 = 6th character slot; 0x80 = samurai and ninja classes; 0x100 = elven race; 0x200 = unknown flag2; 0x400 = send UO3D client type (client will send 0xE1 packet); 0x800 = unknown flag3; 0x1000 = 7th character slot; 0x2000 = unknown flag4; 0x4000 = new movement system; 0x8000 = unlock new felucca areas)
Packet.Note: Each flag is for each feature, if you need to combine features, you need to summ flags. Unknown Flag1 never was sent by OSI. Unknown Flag 2 was added with UO:KR launch. Unknown Flag 3 was added sometimes between UO:KR and UO:SA launch. Flag 4 was added with UO:SA launch. All 4 flags are useless: no client reaction. Last character slot for SA 3D clients: it will highlight last character used. 0x8000 flag is used for unlocking new Felucca factions areas, note that you have to use "_x" versions of map/statics if you want to move through new areas.
Since 7.0.13.0 and 4.0.13.0 City Name and Building Name have length of 32 chars, also added city x,y,z,map,cliloc description and dword 0 to city structure.

Packet.Name: Unicode Speech
Packet.Data: Mode (0x00 = say, 0x01 = system, 0x02 = emote, 0x06 = label, 0x07 = focus, 0x08 = whipser, 0x09 = yell, 0x10 = spell, 0x13 = guild, 0x14 = alliance, 0x15 = GM, 0xC0 = encoded commands)
Packet.Note: If Mode = 0xC0 then there are keywords (from speech.mul) present. Keywords are using in UO since 2.0.7 client. Keywords: The first 12 bits = the number of keywords present. The keywords are included right after this, each one is 12 bits also. The keywords are padded to the closest byte. For example, if there are 2 keywords, it will take up 5 bytes. 12 bits for the number, and 12 bits for each keyword. 12+12+12=36. Which will be padded 4 bits to 40 bits or 5 bytes.

Packet.Name: Unicode Text
Packet.Data: Mode (0x00 = say, 0x01 = system, 0x02 = emote, 0x06 = label, 0x07 = focus, 0x08 = whipser, 0x09 = yell, 0x10 = spell, 0x13 = guild, 0x14 = alliance, 0x15 = GM, 0xC0 = encoded commands)

Packet.Name: Generic Gump
Packet.Note: Gump ID is special type id. See link below for more information.

Packet.Name: Gump Response
Packet.Data: Text Entry ID (Only if Gump ID = 0x1CD and Button ID = 0x01 and Switches Count > 0x00)

Packet.Name: Chat Action
Packet.Data: Action (0x41 = Change Channel Password, 0x42 = UO3D Kick, 0x43 = UO3D Leave Channel, 0x44 = UO3D Join Channel, 0x45 = UO3D Join New Channel, 0x46 = UO3D Add Friend, 0x47 = UO3D Remove Friend, 0x49 = UO3D List Channel Players, 0x58 = Leave Chat, 0x61 = Channel Message, 0x62 = Join Channel, 0x63 = Join New Channel, 0x64 = Rename Channel, 0x65 = Private Message, 0x66 = Add Ignore, 0x67 = Remove Ignore, 0x68 = Toggle Ignore, 0x69 = Add Voice, 0x6A = Remove Voice, 0x6B = Toggle Voice, 0x6C = Add Moderator, 0x6D = Remove Moderator, 0x6E = Toggle Moderator, 0x6F = Allow Private Messages, 0x70 = Disallow Private Messages, 0x71 = Toggle Private Messages, 0x72 = Show Character Name, 0x73 = Hide Character Name, 0x74 = Toggle Character Name, 0x75 = Query Whois, 0x76 = Kick, 0x77 = Enable Default Voice, 0x78 = Disable Default Voice, 0x79 = Toggle Default Voice, 0x7A = Emote Message)

Packet.Name: Supported Features
Packet.Data: Flags (0x01 = enable T2A features: chat button, regions; 0x02 = enable renaissance features; 0x04 = enable third down features; 0x08 = enable LBR features: skills, map; 0x10 = enable AOS features: skills, spells, map, fightbook, housing tiles; 0x20 = enable 6th character slot; 0x40 = enable SE features: spells, skills, map, housing tiles; 0x80 = enable ML features: elven race, spells, skills, housing tiles; 0x100 = enable The Eight Age splash screen; 0x200 = enable The Ninth Age splash screen and crystal/shadow housing tiles; 0x400 = enable The Tenth Age; 0x800 = enable increased housing and bank storage; 0x1000 = enable 7th character slot; 0x2000 = enable roleplay faces; 0x4000 = trial account; 0x8000 = non-trial (live) account; 0x10000 = enable SA features: gargoyle race, spells, skills, housing tiles; 0x20000 - enable HS features; 0x40000 - enable Gothic housing tiles; 0x80000 - enable Rustic housing tiles)
Packet.Note: Each flag is for each feature, if you need to combine features, you need to summ flags. This packet is send immediately after login. on OSI servers this controls features: OSI enables/disables it via upgrade codes. since UO:SA launch its 5 bytes packet, not 3 bytes.

Packet.Name: Display Quest Pointer
Packet.Note: Target Serial was added in UO:HS clients.

Packet.Name: Season Change
Packet.Data: Season (0x00 = spring, 0x01 = summer, 0x02 = fall, 0x03 = winter, 0x04 = desolation)

Packet.Name: Client Version
Packet.Note: Only in 2D/UOTD clients.

Packet.Name: Fast Walk
Packet.Note: Cycle's through the keys in the stack when walking.

Packet.Name: Add Walk Key
Packet.Note: Add a key to the top of the Walk Stack.

Packet.Name: Map Change
Packet.Data: Map ID (0x00 = Felucca, 0x01 = Trammel, 0x02 = Ilshenar, 0x03 = Malas, 0x04 = Tokuno, 0x05 = TerMur)

Packet.Name: Client Info
Packet.Data: Client Flags (0x01 = Felucca Facet, 0x02 = Trammel Facet, 0x04 = Ilshenar Facet, 0x08 = Malas Facet, 0x10 = Tokuno Facet, 0x20 = Ter Mur Facet, 0x40 = UO3D Client, 0x80 = Reserved for Facet06, 0x100 = UOTD)
Packet.Note: Only 2D client packet. Additional way to say server how many facets 2D client has.

Packet.Name: Display Context Menu (Old version)
Packet.Data: Context Menu Entry Flags (0x00 = Enabled, 0x01 = Disabled, 0x04 = Highlighted, 0x20 = Colored)
Context Menu Entry Hue (If Flags = 0x20, only in 2D client)
Packet.Note: Discontinued in new 3D client, later in 2d client.

Packet.Name: Display Context Menu
Packet.Data: Context Menu Entry Flags (0x00 = Enabled, 0x01 = Disabled, 0x04 = Highlighted, 0x20 = Colored)
Context Menu Entry Hue (If Flags = 0x20, only in 2D client)
Packet.Note: Appearance: KR -> SA3D -> 2D post 7.0.0.0

Packet.Name: Close User Interface Window
Packet.Data: Command (0x01 = Paperdoll Window, 0x02 = Status Window, 0x08 = Profile Window, 0x0C = Container Window)
Object Serial (for 0x0C - container serial, for other types - mobile serial)

Packet.Name: Stat Lock Info
Packet.Note: StrLock = StrLock left-shift 4. DexLock = DexLock left-shift 2.

Packet.Name: UO3D Stat Lock Info
Packet.Note: StrLock = StrLock left-shift 4. DexLock = DexLock left-shift 2.

Packet.Name: Update Mobile Status Animation
Packet.Note: OSI uses this packet for updating character statues.

Packet.Name: New Bonded Status
Packet.Note: OSI uses this packet for sending pet's bonded status. It replaced the original 0xBF.0x19.0x00 bonded status packet.

Packet.Name: Cast Spell
Packet.Data: Type (0x00 = no spellbook, has spell, 0x01 = has spellbook, 0x02 = no spell)

Spell ID (0x1-0x40 = Mage Spells, 0x65-0x75 = Necromanser Spells, 0xC9-0xD2 = Paladin Spells, 0x191-0x196 = Samurai Spells, 0x1F5-0x1FC = Ninja Spells, 0x259-0x268 = Arcanist Spells, 0x2A6-0x2B5 = Mystic Spells)
Packet.Note: In latest clients, type is always 0x02.

Packet.Name: Toggle Special Moves
Packet.Data: Spell ID (0x1-0x40 = Mage Spells, 0x65-0x75 = Necromanser Spells, 0xC9-0xD2 = Paladin Spells, 0x191-0x196 = Samurai Spells, 0x1F5-0x1FC = Ninja Spells, 0x259-0x268 = Arcanist Spells, 0x2A6-0x2B5 = Mystic Spells)

Packet.Name: Set Mobile Animation
Packet.Note: Serial is word, it's not a typo. OSI sends last two bytes of serial.

Packet.Name: Cast Targeted Spell
Packet.Data: Spell ID (0x1-0x40 = Mage Spells, 0x65-0x75 = Necromanser Spells, 0xC9-0xD2 = Paladin Spells, 0x191-0x196 = Samurai Spells, 0x1F5-0x1FC = Ninja Spells, 0x259-0x268 = Arcanist Spells, 0x2A6-0x2B5 = Mystic Spells)

Packet.Name: Use Targeted Skill
Packet.Data: Skill ID (from 1 to 58 at present time, if SkillID = 0, it means that is lastskill)

Packet.Name: KR House Menu Response
Packet.Data: Command (0x63 = default, 0x65 = change public/private, 0x66 = convert into customizable, 0x68 = relocation moving crate, 0x69 = change sign house, 0x6A = change sign hanger, 0x6B = change sign post, 0x6C = change foundation style, 0x6D = rename house, 0x6E = demolish house, 0x6F = trade house, 0x70 = make primary, 0x71 = change to co-owner, 0x72 = change to friend, 0x73 = change to access, 0x74 = ban, 0x75 = remove co-owner, 0x76 = remove friend, 0x77 = remove access, 0x78 = remove ban, 0x79 = clear co-owners list, 0x7A = clear friends list, 0x7B = clear access list, 0x7C = clear bans list, 0x7D = add access, 0x7E = valid add access, 0x7F = invalid add access, 0x80 = customize house)
Packet.Note: Parameter = 0x00 for command = 0x63, 0x65, client-side 0x66, client-side 0x68, client-side 0x6D, client-side 0x6E, client-side 0x6F, client-side 0x70, 0x74, client-side 0x79, client-side 0x7A, client-side 0x7B, client-side 0x7C, 0x7D, 0x7F, client-side 0x80. Parameter = 0x01 for command = server-side 0x66, server-side 0x68, server-side 0x6D, server-side 0x6E, server-side 0x6F, server-side 0x70, server-side 0x79, server-side 0x7A, server-side 0x7B, server-side 0x7C. Parameter = Sign Item ID for command = 0x69, Sign Hanger Item ID for command 0x6A, Sign Post Item ID for command 0x6B, Foundation Item ID for command 0x6C, House Foundation Serial for server-side command 0x80. Parameter = Player Serial for command = 0x71, 0x72, 0x73, 0x75, 0x76, 0x77, 0x78, 0x7E.

Packet.Name: UO3D Target By Resource Macro
Packet.Desc: UO3D Target By Resource Macro Packet.
Packet.Data: Resource Type (0x00 = ore, 0x01 = sand, 0x02 = wood, 0x03 = graves, 0x04 = red mushrooms)

Packet.Name: UO3D Start Hotbar Slot Timer
Packet.Desc: UO3D Start Hotbar Slot Timer Packet.
Packet.Note: Start timer for hotbar slot with object having ItemID from packet. Timer will work for all slot with objects having ItemID from packet. 2.48.0.7 KR only bandages itemid works, ItemIDs are 0xE21 and 0xEE9.

Packet.Name: Wheel Boat Moving
Packet.Data: Boat Speed (0 = Stop Movement, 1 = One Tile Movement, 2 = Normal Movement)
Packet.Note: Was added in UO:HS clients. Moving Direction = Facing Direction + Command Direction. Normal Movement - fast for all ships except of rowboats.

Packet.Name: Hued Effect
Packet.Data: Type (0x00 = from source to destination, 0x01 = lightning strike, 0x02 = stay with destination, 0x03 = stay with source)

Packet.Name: Localized Message
Packet.Data: Message Type (0x00 = Regular, 0x01 = System, 0x02 = Emote, 0x06 = Label, 0x07 = Focus, 0x08 = Whisper, 0x09 = Yell, 0x0A = Spell, 0x0D = Guild, 0x0E = Alliance, 0x0F = GM Request, 0x10 = GM Response, 0x20 = Special, 0xC0 = Encoded

Packet.Name: Unicode Prompt
Packet.Note: Prompt ID is special type id. See link below for more information.

Packet.Name: GQ Request
Packet.Data: Map (0x00 = felucca, 0x01 = trammel, 0x02 = ilshenar, 0x03 = malas, 0x04 = tokuno, 0x05 = termur)

Packet.Name: Particle Effect Enable
Packet.Data: Type (0x00 = from source to destination, 0x01 = lightning strike, 0x02 = stay with destination, 0x03 = stay with source)

Packet.Name: Message Localized Affix
Packet.Data: Message Type (0x00 = Regular, 0x01 = System, 0x02 = Emote, 0x06 = Label, 0x07 = Focus, 0x08 = Whisper, 0x09 = Yell, 0x0A = Spell, 0x0D = Guild, 0x0E = Alliance, 0x0F = GM Request, 0x10 = GM Response, 0x20 = Special, 0xC0 = Encoded

Packet.Name: Designer Action 2D
Packet.Note: Client sends this packet only if Enable Response is set to 0x01 in 0xD8 packet

Packet.Name: Designer Action 3D
Packet.Note: Client sends this packet only if Enable Response is set to 0x01 in 0xD8 packet

Packet.Name: Design State Detailed
Packet.Note: Flags = (((Size right_shift 4) and 0xF0) | ((Length right_shift 8) and 0xF)) )

Packet.Name: Hardware Info
Packet.Data: Client Type (0x01 = client version before 4.0.1a, 0x02 = client version above or equal 4.0.1a)

Packet.Name: Mahjong Game General Info
Packet.Data: Dealer Indicator Wind (0x00 = North, 0x01 = East, 0x02 = South, 0x03 = West)
Dialer Indicator Direction (0x00 = Up, 0x01 = Down, 0x02 = Left, 0x03 = Right)

Packet.Name: Mahjong Game Move Wall Break Indicator
Packet.Desc: Mahjong Game Move Wall Break Indicator Packet.

Packet.Name: Mahjong Game Toggle Public Hand
Packet.Desc: Mahjong Game Toggle Public Hand Packet.

Packet.Name: Mahjong Game Move Tile
Packet.Data: Current Direction (0x00 = Up, 0x01 = Down, 0x02 = Left, 0x03 = Right)
New Direction (0x00 = Up, 0x01 = Down, 0x02 = Left, 0x03 = Right)

Packet.Name: Mahjong Game Move Dealer Indicator
Packet.Desc: Mahjong Game Move Dealer Indicator Packet.

Packet.Name: Character Transfer Log
Packet.Note: After receiving this packet, client will generate translog.txt in it's directory.

Packet.Name: OPL Info
Packet.Note: Since 4.0.5a client, replaced BF.10

Packet.Name: Compressed Gump
Packet.Note: Since 5.0.0a client. Use ZLib compression with Z_BEST_SPEED compression level.
Gump ID is special type id. See link below for more information.

Packet.Name: Buffs And Attributes
Packet.Data: Buff Type(BonusStr = 0x01, BonusDex = 0x02, BonusInt = 0x03, BonusHits = 0x07, BonusStamina = 0x08, BonusMana = 0x09, RegenHits = 0x0A, RegenStam = 0x0B, RegenMana = 0x0C, NightSight = 0x0D, Luck = 0x0E, ReflectPhysical = 0x10, EnhancePotions = 0x11, AttackChance = 0x12, DefendChance = 0x13, SpellDamage = 0x14, CastRecovery = 0x15, CastSpeed = 0x16, ManaCost = 0x17, ReagentCost = 0x18, WeaponSpeed = 0x19, WeaponDamage = 0x1A, PhysicalResistance = 0x1B, FireResistance = 0x1C, ColdResistance = 0x1D, PoisonResistance = 0x1E, EnergyResistance = 0x1F, MaxPhysicalResistance = 0x20, MaxFireResistance = 0x21, MaxColdResistance = 0x22, MaxPoisonResistance = 0x23, MaxEnergyResistance = 0x24, AmmoCost = 0x26, KarmaLoss = 0x28, 0x3EA+ = buff icons)

Source Type (0 = Character, 50 = two-handed weapon, 53 = one-handed weapon or spellbook, 54 = shield or ranged weapon, 55 = shoes, 56 = pants or legs, 58 = helm or hat, 59 = gloves, 60 = ring, 61 = talisman, 62 = necklace or gorget, 64 = waist, 65 = inner torso, 66 = bracelet, 69 = middle torso, 70 = earring, 71 = arms, 72 = cloak or quiver, 74 = outer torso, 1000 = spells)
Buff Queue Index (Delta Value for attributes)
Buff Duration in seconds (0 for attributes)
Primary Cliloc Arguments Length (0 for attributes)
Secondary Cliloc Arguments Length (0 for attributes)
Third Cliloc Arguments Length (0 for attributes)

Packet.Name: Bug Report
Packet.Data: Bug Category (0x01 - World Environment; 0x02 Wearables; 0x03 Combat; 0x04 UI; 0x05 Crash; 0x06 Stuck; 0x07 Animations; 0x08 Performance; 0x09 NPCs; 0x0A Creatures; 0x0B Pets; 0x0C Housing; 0x0D - Lost Item; 0x0E Exploit; 0x0F Other)

Packet.Name: New Mobile Animation
Packet.Data: Animation Type (0 = Attack, 1 = Parry, 2 = Block, 3 = Die, 4 = Impact, 5 = Fidget, 6 = Eat, 7 = Emote, 8 = Alert, 9 = TakeOff, 10 = Land, 11 = Spell, 12 = StartCombat, 13 = EndCombat, 14 = Pillage, 15 = Spawn)
Packet.Note: Replaces 0x6E packet. Since 7.0.0.0 in 2D, was in UO:KR clients, now in UO:SA clients. Action is optional parameter for some types: attack, emote, spell.

Packet.Name: UO3D Display Waypoint
Packet.Data: Object Type (None = 0x00, Corpse = 0x01, Party = 0x02, Quest = 0x04, QuestDestination = 0x05, Resurrection = 0x06)
Packet.Note: If Ignore Object Serial is true, client will use coordinates from packet and will ignore serial object coordinates.

Packet.Name: UO3D Remove Highlight UI-Element
Packet.Note: Response to E7 packet.

Packet.Name: UO3D Toggle Highlight UI-Element
Packet.Note: Description types: ToggleInventory, TogglePaperdoll, ToggleMap,

Packet.Name: UO3D Use Hotbar Response
Packet.Data: Type (0x1 spell, 0x2 weapon ability, 0x3 skill, 0x4 item, 0x5 scroll)
Packet.Note: Client sends this packet only if server sent EA packet before. Object ID: serial for item, id for other types. Always in reversed mode. Note: since KR 2.46.*.* Object ID is serial for scroll too. Sometimes between 2.48.0.3 and 2.59.0.2 they changed it again: now type is always 0x06.

Packet.Name: UO3D Unequip Items Macro
Packet.Data: Item Layer (0x00 = Invalid, 0x01 = One Handed, 0x02 = Tho Handed, 0x03 = Shoes, 0x04 = Pants; 0x05 = Shirt, 0x06 = Helm, 0x07 = Gloves, 0x08 = Ring, 0x09 = Talisman, 0x0A = Neck, 0x0B = Hair, 0x0C = Waist, 0x0D = Inner Torso, 0x0E = Bracelet, 0x0F = Face, 0x10 = Facial Hair, 0x11 = Middle Torso, 0x12 = Earrings, 0x13 = Arms, 0x14 = Cloak, 0x15 = Backpack, 0x16 = Outer Torso, 0x17 = Outer Legs, 0x18 = Inner Legs, 0x19 = Mount, 0x1A = Shop Buy, 0x1B = Shop Resale, 0x1C = Shop Sell, 0x1D = Bank, 0x1E = Shop Max)

Packet.Name: New Movement Request
Packet.Note: DateTime1 and DateTime2 - ticks from Unix time divided by 10000. Client sends this packet on movement attempt. Can be enabled with 0x4000 flag in 0xA9 packet.

Packet.Name: Client-Server Time Synchronization Request
Packet.Note: DateTime - ticks from Unix time divided by 10000. Client sends this packet each minute. Can be enabled with 0x4000 flag in 0xA9 packet.

Packet.Name: Client-Server Time Synchronization Response
Packet.Note: DateTime1, DateTime2 and DateTime3 - ticks from Unix time divided by 10000. Server sends this packet after client's request (0xF1). Can be enabled with 0x4000 flag in 0xA9 packet.

Packet.Name: New World Object Packet
Packet.Data: Data Type (0x00 = use TileData, 0x01 = use BodyData, 0x02 = use MultiData)
Access (for items only, 0x01 = Player Item, 0x00 = World Item)
Packet.Note: First appearance in UO:SA clients, replaces 0x1A packet.

Packet.Name: Crash Report Packet
Packet.Note: Was only for UO3D clients. Since 7.0.8.0 it's also for 2d clients with slightly changed format.

Packet.Name: Boat Moving Packet
Packet.Data: Boat Speed (0x01 = one tile, 0x02 = rowboat, 0x03 = slow, 0x04 = fast)
Packet.Note: Was added in UO:HS clients. Moving Direction = Facing Direction + Command Direction.

Packet.Name: Packet Container Packet
Packet.Note: Was added in UO:HS clients. Currently uses for multis, contains F3 packets.

Packet.Name: New Character Creation
Packet.Desc: Create a new character (2D clients since 7.0.16.0).
Packet.Data: Client Flags (0x01 = Felucca Facet, 0x02 = Trammel Facet, 0x04 = Ilshenar Facet, 0x08 = Malas Facet, 0x10 = Tokuno Facet, 0x20 = Ter Mur Facet, 0x40 = UO3D Client, 0x80 = Reserved for Facet06, 0x100 = UOTD)
Gender and Race: (0x00 = human male, 0x01 = human female, 0x02 = human male, 0x03 = human female, 0x04 = elf male, 0x05 = elf female, 0x06 = gargoyle male, 0x07 = gargoyle female)
Packet.Note: Was added in 7.0.16.0 client. Replaced 0x00 packet. Has 2 more bytes for skill #4
